result_list.explanation: Il lève sa canne. (He raises his cane.) This is an interaction with an object.
Ils le frappent. (They hit him.) This is a violent action.
Il les met en termes de combattre. (He puts them in terms of combat.) This suggests a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Il les met en termes de combattre.

result_list.explanation: Il met la main à un poignard. (He puts his hand on a dagger.) This suggests a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Il met la main à un poignard.

result_list.explanation: On égorge les Victimes. (They slaughter the Victims.) This is a violent action.
On entend un bruit de guerre. (One hears the sound of war.) This is a description of a sound.
result_list.stgdir: On entend un bruit de guerre.

result_list.explanation: Il fait un massacre de Polonais. (He makes a massacre of Poles.) This is a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Il fait un massacre de Polonais.

result_list.explanation: Dorante veut tirer son épée. (Dorante wants to draw his sword.) This suggests a violent action.
Elle tire un poignard. (She draws a dagger.) This suggests a violent action.
Frappant la Chicanne. (Hitting the Chicanne.) This is a violent action.
Il frappe Arlequin. (He hits Arlequin.) This is a violent action.
Amadis combat contre Arcalaüs. (Amadis fights against Arcalaüs.) This is a violent action.
Il frappe Scaramouche de toute sa force. (He hits Scaramouche with all his strength.) This is a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Il frappe Scaramouche de toute sa force.

result_list.explanation: Les Turcs répètent les mêmes vers, et lui donnent plusieurs coups de bâton en cadence. (The Turks repeat the same lines, and give him several blows with a stick in rhythm.) This is a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Les Turcs répètent les mêmes vers, et lui donnent plusieurs coups de bâton en cadence.

result_list.explanation: Le petit Blandineau et sa soeur battent Jannot, qui se laisse battre. (The little Blandineau and his sister beat Jannot, who lets himself be beaten.) This is a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Le petit Blandineau et sa soeur battent Jannot, qui se laisse battre.

result_list.explanation: Quatre lutins se jettent sur Arlequin et l'ayant mis dans une couverture ils le bernent. (Four goblins throw themselves on Arlequin and having put him in a blanket they rock him.) This is a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Quatre lutins se jettent sur Arlequin et l'ayant mis dans une couverture ils le bernent.

result_list.explanation: On forme un combat à la manière des anciens. (A combat is formed in the manner of the ancients.) This suggests a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: On forme un combat à la manière des anciens.

result_list.explanation: Il en donne dans la porte qu'il met par terre. (He gives it to the door which he puts on the ground.) This suggests a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Il en donne dans la porte qu'il met par terre.

result_list.explanation: [À part]. (Aside.) This is an aside.
[À part. Il ne parle point de Calatabellotte.] (Aside. He does not speak of Calatabellotte.) This is an aside.
result_list.stgdir: [À part. Il ne parle point de Calatabellotte.]

result_list.explanation: À part, avec ironie. (Aside, with irony.) This is an aside.
À part, après avoir lu. (Aside, after reading.) This is an aside.
Il dit ces quatre vers bas. (He says these four lines softly.) This describes the manner of delivery.
result_list.stgdir: Il dit ces quatre vers bas.

result_list.explanation: Le Mufti, après l'avoir fait bâtonner, lui dit en chantant : (The Mufti, after having him beaten, says to him singing:) This suggests a violent action.
result_list.stgdir: Le Mufti, après l'avoir fait bâtonner, lui dit en chantant :

result_list.explanation: Il chante avec Galaor. (He sings with Galaor.) This is a music description.
On entend crier de loin Ruflaut et Jeannot. (One hears Ruflaut and Jeannot screaming from afar.) This describes a sound.
result_list.stgdir: On entend crier de loin Ruflaut et Jeannot.

result_list.explanation: Après un silence. (After a silence.) This describes the manner of delivery.
D'un air d'importance. (With an air of importance.) This describes the manner of delivery.
On entend Sosie qui chante. (One hears Sosie singing.) This describes a sound.
Le Choeur des Bergers répète ces deux derniers Vers. (The Choir of Shepherds repeats these last two lines.) This is a music description.
result_list.stgdir: Le Choeur des Bergers répète ces deux derniers Vers.

result_list.explanation: Il appelle ses valets. (He calls his servants.) This is a general character action.
ENSEMBLE (Together.) This is a music description.
Il rappelle Monsieur Oronte. (He calls back Monsieur Oronte.) This is a general character action.
Léandre, Mélite, Doris, Céphise et Ismène parlent ensemble. (Leandre, Mélite, Doris, Céphise and Ismène speak together.) This is a non-verbal interaction.
result_list.stgdir: Léandre, Mélite, Doris, Céphise et Ismène parlent ensemble.

result_list.explanation: Criant très fort. (Screaming very loudly.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Ils rient. (They laugh.) This is a general character action.
Ici l'actrice chante un morceau à son choix. (Here the actress sings a piece of her choice.) This is a music description.
result_list.stgdir: Ici l'actrice chante un morceau à son choix.

result_list.explanation: Triomphalement. (Triumphantly.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Avec ravissement. (With rapture.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Reprise de Choeur. (Choir reprise.) This is a music description.
Elle pleure amèrement. (She cries bitterly.) This describes the manner of delivery.
[Il interrompt la lecture. ] (He interrupts the reading.) This is an aside.
À mi-voix. (Half-voice.) This describes the manner of delivery.
S'échauffant. (Getting heated.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Avec humeur. (With ill-humor.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Ronchaud prend un air sévère. (Ronchaud takes a severe air.) This is a general character action.
Il chante sur un air ridicule qu'il improvise. (He sings on a ridiculous tune that he improvises.) This is a music description.
result_list.stgdir: Il chante sur un air ridicule qu'il improvise.

result_list.explanation: À demi-voix. (Half-voice.) This describes the manner of delivery.
On entend des clameurs en dehors. (One hears clamors from outside.) This describes a sound.
result_list.stgdir: On entend des clameurs en dehors.

result_list.explanation: Criant au travers de la porte. (Screaming through the door.) This describes the manner of delivery.
result_list.stgdir: Criant au travers de la porte.

result_list.explanation: Ici un grand silence. (Here a great silence.) This describes the manner of delivery.

Il rit. Laurent rentre vivement, l'oeil hagard, comme s'il était poursuivi ; il s'appuie un instant contre l'armoire. (He laughs. Laurent enters quickly, with a haggard eye, as if he were being pursued; he leans for a moment against the cupboard.) This is a general character action.
result_list.stgdir: Il rit. Laurent rentre vivement, l'oeil hagard, comme s'il était poursuivi ; il s'appuie un instant contre l'armoire.

result_list.explanation: Il prélude encore. (He preludes again.) This is a music description.
Aux cris que pousse Thécla. (At the cries that Thécla utters.) This describes a sound.
On entend dans le lointain des cris et une marche militaire. (One hears cries and a military march in the distance.) This describes a sound.
result_list.stgdir: On entend dans le lointain des cris et une marche militaire.

result_list.explanation: Reprenant son ton de voix familier et indifférent. (Resuming his familiar and indifferent tone of voice.) This describes the manner of delivery.
result_list.stgdir: Reprenant son ton de voix familier et indifférent.

result_list.explanation: Parlant. (Speaking.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Avec feu. (With passion.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Frappant du pied. (Stamping his foot.) This is a general character action.
Toutes les jeunes filles rient, à l'exception de Justine. (All the young girls laugh, except Justine.) This is a general character action.
result_list.stgdir: Toutes les jeunes filles rient, à l'exception de Justine.

result_list.explanation: Ils parlent tous quatre en même temps. (They all four speak at the same time.) This is a non-verbal interaction.
result_list.stgdir: Ils parlent tous quatre en même temps.

result_list.explanation: Il chante. (He sings.) This is a music description.
Baissant sa voix. (Lowering his voice.) This describes the manner of delivery.
On n'entend pas le reste. (One does not hear the rest.) This describes a sound.
Tous partent d'un éclat de rire. (Everyone bursts into laughter.) This is a general character action.
result_list.stgdir: Tous partent d'un éclat de rire.

result_list.explanation: Il sort en chantant. (He exits singing.) This is a character exit.
Il chante un petit motet. (He sings a small motet.) This is a music description.
Répondant. (Answering.) This is a non-verbal interaction.
On entend la voix de Jérôme qui appelle Babet. (One hears the voice of Jérôme calling Babet.) This describes a sound.
result_list.stgdir: On entend la voix de Jérôme qui appelle Babet.

result_list.explanation: Se remettant. (Recovering.) This is a general character action.
Elle dit ceci bas. (She says this softly.) This is an aside.
Ensemble (Together.) This is a non-verbal interaction.
Avec émotion. (With emotion.) This describes the manner of delivery.
D'un ton sévère. (In a severe tone.) This describes the manner of delivery.
Plus haut encore. (Even louder.) This describes the manner of delivery.
